question.title: Proguard RoboGuice Obfuscate Error on ViewListener

node.contents: I have proguard and roboguice working together as long as I don't turn on the obfuscate option. Once I remove dontobfuscate from my progaurd-project.txt file, I receive the following error:

astNode.text: I have proguard and roboguice working together as long as I don't turn on the obfuscate option. Once I remove dontobfuscate from my progaurd-project.txt file, I receive the following error:

node.contents: Does anyone have any ideas on how to fix that error? Here is my configuration file

-printseeds ../bin/seeds.txt
-printusage ../bin/unused.txt
-printmapping ../bin/mapping.txt 

# The -optimizations option disables some arithmetic simplifications that Dalvik 1.0 and 1.5 can't handle. 
-optimizations !code/simplification/arithmetic,!field/*,!class/merging/*

-keep public class * extends

# Explicitly preserve all serialization members. The Serializable interface
# is only a marker interface, so it wouldn't save them.
-keepclassmembers class * implements

when working with fields. Proguard
# removes such information by default, so configure it to keep all of it.
-keepattributes Signature


# Gson specific classes
-keep

node.contents: @dirkoneill If you are using a standard Android build process (Ant/Eclipse/Gradle), it specifies all generic options and IO options (like `-libraryjars`) for you. Your configuration file should only contain project-specific options, like `-keep class roboguice.** { *; }`.

astNode.text: @dirkoneill If you are using a standard Android build process (Ant/Eclipse/Gradle), it specifies all generic options and IO options (like `-libraryjars`) for you. Your configuration file should only contain project-specific options, like `-keep class roboguice.** { *; }`.

node.contents: So I already had -keep public class roboguice.** but this and maybe some other changes seem to have fixed the issue. Thanks

astNode.text: So I already had -keep public class roboguice.** but this and maybe some other changes seem to have fixed the issue. Thanks

node.contents: I'm not a proguard expert, but it looks like it is still obfuscating the roboguice library even though you have it included in the -libraryjars section. You could try to exclude it via its package.

astNode.text: I'm not a proguard expert, but it looks like it is still obfuscating the roboguice library even though you have it included in the -libraryjars section. You could try to exclude it via its package.
